title: Zen-Based e-Learning Content Development Workshop for Teachers

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematics pedagogy knowledge and experience with digital tools
context.additional_context: Participants progressively experience creating H5P interactive content for real math lesson design, including iterative improvements through peer review and expert feedback.

learning_goals: Learners can independently produce three H5P math education contents reflecting Zen philosophy’s five principles (focus, simplicity, harmony, nature, mindfulness) by applying ADDIE model’s four phases (analysis, design, development, implementation)
The content can be revised to meet an effectiveness satisfaction level of over 80% through peer teacher and expert evaluations
Demonstrate the process of creating responsive interactive learning materials using H5P authoring tools in a BYOD environment and uploading them to an LMS

resources: Access Permissions for LMS (Learning Management System) Platforms
Multimedia Resource Collection for Mathematics Education

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
